question: Process scheduling is used by the OS to manage the execution of multiple _______.
A queue that holds all processes waiting to be executed is called the _______.
The _______ Queue contains processes that are ready to run and waiting for CPU time.
A process that is waiting for an I/O operation moves to the _______ Queue.
Which scheduler is responsible for deciding which processes should enter the ready queue?
The _______ scheduler decides which process gets CPU time next from the ready queue.
The Medium-Term Scheduler performs a process known as _______.
Context switching happens when the CPU switches from one _______ to another.
During a context switch, the OS must save and restore the state of the _______.
Which of the following scheduling queues contains processes that are waiting for an external event, such as input from a user?
